Replace.Text: Each unique district built gives +3 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing, +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food, and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to lake and coastal tiles.

Gain 500% more [ICON_GREATMUSICIAN] Great Musician points, +4 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +4 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, +4 [ICON_FAITH] Faith, +4 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, +4 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science, and 400% more [ICON_GREATWORK_MUSIC] Travel benefits from Great Works of Music. The Palace provides 5 Great Works slots.

Xiosta Cultural Heritage Area replaces the Theater Square Area, and requires half the production capacity. Gain 1 [ICON_GREATWRITER] Great Writer Point, and 3 [ICON_GREATMUSICIAN] Great Musician Points. Xiosta Music Hall provides [ICON_FAITH] Faith equal to the Culture Bonus. Each adjacent area gains the standard Culture Bonus, and each adjacent Wonder, Coast, and Lake gains double the Culture Bonus. Citizens provide additional [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_GOLD] Gold Bonus.
Xiosta unique building, replaces the Roman Theatre, +3 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, 1 [ICON_GREATWRITER] Great Writer point, 3 [ICON_GREATMUSICIAN] Great Musician points, and provides 2 Great Works slots.

A Seastar unique building that replaces the Art Gallery, grants +3 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, 1 [ICON_GREATWRITER] Great Writer point, 3 [ICON_GREATMUSICIAN] Great Musician points, and 3 Great Works slots. Cannot be built if there is already a heavy metal venue in the Seastar Music Hall area.

A Xiosta unique building that replaces the Archaeological Museum. It provides +3 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, 1 [ICON_GREATWRITER] Great Writer, 3 [ICON_GREATMUSICIAN] Great Musician, and 2 Great Works. Upon completion, it grants a Rock Band. It cannot be built if there is already a music venue in the Xiosta Music Hall area.
